column4: can i please get some help with my sould card not shoeing up properly
sound*
it is a digital and analog card only showing up as analog
do you see your cards in 'cat /proc/asound/cards'?
yes  0 [Intel          ]: HDA-Intel - HDA Intel
and intel-hda is your sound card, right?
its the built in one yes
I suppose you are using pulseaudio by default, install pavucontrol: sudo apt-get install pavucontrol
apt-get install pavucontrol
pavucontrol is already the newest version
run as user (or from menu): pavucontrol
check "Output devices", "Configuration"
its showing up as a analog only card
but you want digital, like HDMI, DisplayPort?
it has a rca style digital input and output connection
can you find that in Configuration?
nope its all analog options
then, I suppose it's a kernel issue :(
the audio card is Intel Corporation 82801FB/FBM/FR/FW/FRW (ICH6 Family) High Definition Audio Controller (rev 03)
I don't even know what rca is :( my intel-hda has HDMI, and it's in pavucontrol auto
rca is the style of connection for the digital on the motherboard
skumara , sorry, got to run, ask your questions to the channel
